intro: Bryodesma njamnjamense, commonly known as the African water fern, is a species of aquatic fern found in freshwater habitats across sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Marsileaceae and is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are often clustered in groups of four. The plant is adapted to thrive in slow-moving or still water, where it can anchor itself to submerged surfaces. Its reproductive structures include tiny, inconspicuous flowers that develop into small, round fruits. Bryodesma njamnjamense plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
